column4: Arg! Can anyone explain this? My Mac OS 10.4 laptop can get an address via DHCP from my cable modem, but my router and my fiesty box can't. (!!!)
is the router and laptop connected directly to the modem? I assume if ys that means the modem has two ethernet ports?
No, I have the router unplugged at the moment. Modem only has one ethernet port.
so what is the usual network setup? Router plugged into modem and laptop and other devices connected through router?
yep
did your modem previously work?
yes, everything worked normally for months.
well what did you do right before it stopped working?
lol, nothing.
hmmmm...
when you plug in the modem all its lights turn green?
Everything about the modem seems normal.
well, did you ever reset the routers settings?
Yeah, tried that.
what I'm suspecting is that somehow the router wants to use a different mac address and the ISP doesn't like it
hmm, ok, i might be able to have the router spoof the MAC of the mac laptop
does the router in the web interface have the ability to change the mac address?
right, that's what I'd do
have the router spoof a mac address of one of the machines that can connect to the internet when directly connected to the modem
ISP's only allow one mac address to connect to their network through each unique modem to prevent abuse
that worked, I'm wireless again
who knows, that happened to me too
